[{"id":"dev-17221","entityId":"86-22721","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"dev"},{"name":"summary","value":"[Alter Booking] Translations are missing"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Maksym Hopei"},{"name":"created","value":"1580460163016"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"17221"},{"name":"description","value":"

|URL|https://www.regiondo.de/resellers/account/|

Steps to reproduce:

  1. Go to a booking view page in a reseller dashboard (non-EN language)
  2. Open "Alter Booking" tab
  3. Check the texts

Actual result:

Some texts are in English.

Expected result:

All texts have to be in the respective language.

Dear @Alexander Bechte, please provide me with the translations for the following lines for Alter Booking functionality:

  • Booking changed
  • Booking changed (Items)
  • Assign participants to a new price category for the new offer
  • Old
  • Previous total
  • New total
  • Please choose non-zero quantity for each option

URLhttps://www.regiondo.com/customer/account/index
Multi-user account email to checkcontact@theatreinparis.com
Supplier emailcplotard@theatreinparis.com
Supplier ID10044
Novomind Ticket ID75262, 77348, 79070
EnvironmentWindows 10, Chrome Version 68.0.3440.106

==Global issue==

Steps to reproduce:

  1. Login with cplotard@theatreinparis.com > Dashboard » Settings » Multi-User Access > search for account contact@theatreinparis.com > Edit > Check permissions
  2. Login with contact@theatreinparis.com > Dashboard » Statistics » Statistics Export > Filter by order date (eg. 07/01/2020 - 08/01/2020) > Export
  3. Dashboard » Statistics » Reports > Download the file

Actual result:

When you click to download the report there is an error message.
This only happens for multi user accounts

Expected result:

As the multi-user has permissions regarding Statistics, he should be able to download the reports.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1580979138245,"updated":1580979315101,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]}],"tag":[]}, {"id":"dev-17224","entityId":"86-22731","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"dev"},{"name":"summary","value":"[Booking] No ticket generated when altering a booking after partial cancellation"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Kay Endörfer"},{"name":"created","value":"1580731357370"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"17224"},{"name":"description","value":"
URLhttps://www.regiondo.com/resellers/account/bookingsview/key/1-7454182-30273-45105-1580812200/backUrl/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cucmVnaW9uZG8uY29tL3Jlc2VsbGVycy9hY2NvdW50L2Jvb2tpbmdz
Product ID30273
Account emaild.kater@l-t.de
reproduced witheusebiu.radutiu@regiondo.com
Supplier ID12180
Order #3581141813
EnvironmentWindows 10, Chrome Version 79.0.3945.130 (Official Build) (64-bit)



#### Steps to reproduce:
1- Book 2 tickets for product 128647 (Booking number 2081689708 )
Ticket SE133139PX1W7
Ticket SE133IQ2D7U8A

2- Cancel only one ticket SE133139PX1W7


3- Alter ticket SE133IQ2D7U8A to 31-03-2020 12:00 and confirm the change ()



#### Actual result:
1- After altering the booking, No new Ticket is generated

2- Customer receive email Confirmation of change But when he click on see Change, he is redirected to new page which remain Loading


3- This email is not listed in Magento > Message queue


#### Expected result:

1- After altering ticket SE133IQ2D7U8A , Ticket code SE133IQ2D7U8A should be updated (Both ticket should be displayed : the cancelled one + the updated one )


2- Customer should receive the new ticket by email
Example :

{"id":"dev-17091","entityId":"86-22404","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"dev"},{"name":"summary","value":"[Cross-domain][Cookie][Iframe] Get Ready for New SameSite=None; Secure Cookie Settings"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Denys Bulakh"},{"name":"created","value":"1576834548888"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"17091"},{"name":"description","value":"

Please investigate how does it affect Regiondo Iframe integrations.

Google Chrome 80, which is scheduled by Google to be released in February 2020, changes the default behavior of cookies in cross-domain scenarios. Chrome 80 introduces a new default value for cookie attribute: “SameSite=Lax”. (Previously, the SameSite cookie attribute defaulted to “SameSite=None”.)

https://blog.chromium.org/2019/10/developers-get-ready-for-new.html

"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Maksym Hopei"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"d.bulakh"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"8"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"m.hopei"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1580383640549"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"dev-17191","type":"Relates","role":"relates to"},{"value":"dev-17216","type":"Relates","role":"relates to"},{"value":"dev-14645","type":"Relates","role":"relates to"},{"value":"dev-17128","type":"Subtask","role":"parent for"}]},{"name":"When is it needed ?","value":["Major"],"valueId":["Major"],"color":{"bg":"#ffee9c","fg":"#b45f06"}},{"name":"Type","value":["Task"],"valueId":["Task"],"color":null},{"name":"State","value":["Finished - On Live"],"valueId":["Finished - On Live"],"color":{"bg":"#246512","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Reproducible","value":["Yes"],"valueId":["Yes"],"color":null},{"name":"Account Segment","value":["All"],"valueId":["All"],"color":null},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"m.hopei","fullName":"Maksym Hopei"}]},{"name":"Git Branch Name","value":["dev-17091"],"valueId":["dev-17091"],"color":null},{"name":"sprint","value":[{"value":"First sprint","id":"Team Z:First sprint"}]},{"name":"attachments","value":[{"value":"image.png","id":"89-65282","url":"https://track.regiondo.com/_persistent/image.png?file=89-65282&c=true"}]}],"comment":[{"id":"88-64666","author":"d.bulakh","authorFullName":"Denys Bulakh","issueId":"dev-17091","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Maksym Hopei, please investigate this together with @Sergey Chorny, we need to understand which problems would we have in February 2020 with our iframe integrations. Thanks

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1576834671924,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"88-64700","author":"m.hopei","authorFullName":"Maksym Hopei","issueId":"dev-17091","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

In a nutshell: Starting from February 2020 all cookies without explicitly set SameSite attribute will be treated as if they have SameSite=Lax. This will prevent cookies from being used in a cross-domain communication. To overcome this the cookie must have SameSite flag set to None (a newly introduced value) and a Secure flag present.

Required actions:

  • Compile a complete list of cookies used at Regiondo systems. Indicate the following information:
    • Name of the cookie
    • Example value or value type description
    • Domain / path used for the cookie
    • Expiration policy
    • is HttpOnly flag set?
    • is Secure flag set?
    • is used in a cross-domain communication
  • Set the SameSite=None; Secure flags to the cookies that are used in cross-domain communication. The following should be taken in consideration:
    • PHP supports SameSite flag starting from version 7.3, a workaround has to be implemented in case we are not able to upgrade before February 2020, see: https://github.com/GoogleChromeLabs/samesite-examples/blob/master/php.md.
    • There is a list of clients that don't support the None value for the SameSite flag: https://www.chromium.org/updates/same-site/incompatible-clients. The check has to be implemented on backend in order to support these clients.
  • Set the SameSite=Lax or SameSite=Strict flags on other cookies depending on exact needs explicitly, not to rely on browser default settings.

Note: To test the effect of the new Chrome behavior on your site or cookies you manage, you can go to chrome://flags in Chrome 76+ and enable the “SameSite by default cookies” and “Cookies without SameSite must be secure” experiments. (Or from Firefox 69 in about:config by setting network.cookie.sameSite.noneRequiresSecure)

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1577113190668,"updated":1577114368483,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"88-64997","author":"m.hopei","authorFullName":"Maksym Hopei","issueId":"dev-17091","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Current solution:
  • For cookies set from the backend: samesite flag is added via nginx config (delivered to testing)
  • For cookies set from javascript: samesite flag is added in respective files

Denys Bulakh, please review:
  • https://upsource.regiondo.de/infrastructure/review/INFRS-CR-4
  • https://upsource.regiondo.de/regiondo/review/RGND-CR-1794
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1579018021052,"updated":1579018146905,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]},{"id":"88-65239","author":"m.hopei","authorFullName":"Maksym Hopei","issueId":"dev-17091","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Naomi, Igor Dyachenko and others, please test the following:
  • Session cookies are set with SameSite=None and Secure flags.
  • Cookie-related functionality works normally (login/logout, shopping flow, etc.) (autotests).
  • iframe integrations work properly (widgets, checkout, etc. in iframe).

All tests must pass in two browser modes:
1. Default SameSite = None (current browsers behaviour until 04.02.2020)
2. Default SameSite = Lax (future browsers behaviour after 04.02.2020)

To switch browser to the second mode now:
  • Chrome 76+: go to chrome://flags and enable the “SameSite by default cookies” and “Cookies without SameSite must be secure” experiments.
  • Firefox 69: go to about:config and set network.cookie.sameSite.noneRequiresSecure to Yes
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1580117215331,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]},{"id":"88-65306","author":"i.dyachenko","authorFullName":"Igor Dyachenko","issueId":"dev-17091","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

During testing on Staging with enabled "SameSite by default cookies" and "Cookies without SameSite must be secure" flags in Chrome any cookies related issues were NOT found. Let's release the functionality with one live booking acceptance test.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1580286607413,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"88-65328","author":"m.hopei","authorFullName":"Maksym Hopei","issueId":"dev-17091","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Ilya Shevyrev

Deployment steps

Additionally to normal code update please add the following instruction to Nginx configuration for Magento:

location / {
  # ...
  proxy_cookie_path / "/; SameSite=None; Secure";
}
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1580312477646,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"88-65343","author":"d.bulakh","authorFullName":"Denys Bulakh","issueId":"dev-17091","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Ilya Shevyrev , please update nginx configuration on all servers and in aws. Thanks!
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1580334243705,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]},{"id":"88-65344","author":"ilya.shevyrev","authorFullName":"Ilya Shevyrev","issueId":"dev-17091","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Maksym Hopei nginx settings added on live, please check!

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1580364440765,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]}],"tag":[{"value":"Star","cssClass":"c0"}]}, {"id":"dev-17192","entityId":"86-22660","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"dev"},{"name":"summary","value":"[POS][API] Social login with facebook and google"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Viktoriia Karenko"},{"name":"created","value":"1579785912463"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"17192"},{"name":"description","value":"

Please add possibility to login with google and facebook with new oAuth2.0.
If reseller for current email doesn't exist please return an error "Unfortunately we cannot find a Regiondo account for this email address".

Input data:

access_token=facebook/google_access_token
scope=reseller-data,
grant_type=social_login,
client_id=POS,
